definition: excuse me
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
surname Jia
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)

sentences.english: Excuse me, is it possible to see a doctor?
sentences.chinese: 勞駕，可以幫忙找個醫生嗎？

sentences.english: Excuse me, can you show me the cloisonné bracelet in the counter?
sentences.chinese: 勞駕，你能把櫃檯裏的那個景泰藍手鐲給我看看嗎？

sentences.english: Could I possibly impose on you to show my family around Beijing?
sentences.chinese: 勞駕你帶我家人逛一逛北京好嗎？

sentences.english: Excuse me, can you tell me the way to the Hangzhou paradise?
sentences.chinese: 勞駕，請問去杭州樂園怎麼走？

sentences.english: Excuse me. Could you give me a light?
Excuse me, Is this the check-in counter for NW157?
sentences.chinese: 勞駕，這是西北航空公司157班機辦手續的櫃檯嗎？

sentences.english: I'd like a cheeseburger to take away, please.
sentences.chinese: 勞駕，我想買走一個乾酪漢堡包。

sentences.english: Two and two halves to the city centre, please.
sentences.chinese: 勞駕，買去市中心的兩張全票和兩張半票。
勞駕，一張去倫敦的單程票。

sentences.english: Excuse me, I have to get off at the next stop.
sentences.chinese: 勞駕，我必須在下一站下車。

sentences.english: Will you oblige me, Mr. Archer, by first looking through these papers?
sentences.chinese: 阿切爾先生，勞駕你先看一遍這些文件好嗎？

sentences.english: I would like a beef stir fry , please.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一碟炒牛肉，勞駕。

sentences.english: Excuse me , Could you tell me the way to the Empery edifice?
sentences.chinese: 勞駕，先生。請問帝國大廈怎麼走？

sentences.english: I'd like a fish and chips to take out,please.
sentences.chinese: 勞駕，我買一份煎魚和薯條帶走。

sentences.english: Excuse me, May I obtain a cash advance with my Visa card?
sentences.chinese: 勞駕，我可用維澤卡兌換一些錢嗎？

sentences.english: Excuse me. May I see Mr. Lee, the manager?
sentences.chinese: 勞駕。請問我能見李經理嗎？

definition: to make eyes/to wink
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
you're welcome/don't mention it/no need to stand on ceremony
to be generous (idiom)/to be magnanimous/Give me a break!
to make fun of/to seek diversion
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
foolish talk/nonsense
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
tearful/brimming with tears
blueprint/to make a blueprint
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
don't mention it/no formalities, please
to talk nonsense/to bullshit
to start the servers (for an online game, typically after the system has been shut down for maintenance, upgrade etc)
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
conventional greeting/polite formula
